\Aura\Router

\Aura\RouterRoute

Represents an individual route with a name, path, params, values, etc.

In general, you should never need to instantiate a Route directly. Use the RouteFactory instead, or the Map.

$name

$name : string

The name for this Route.

Type

string

Tags

None found

$path

$path : string

The path for this Route with param tokens.

Type

string

Tags

None found

$params

$params : array

A map of param tokens to their regex subpatterns.

Type

array

Tags

None found

$values

$values : array

A map of param tokens to their default values; if this Route is matched, these will retain the corresponding values from the param tokens in the matching path.

Type

array

Tags

None found

$method

$method : array

The `REQUEST_METHOD` value must match one of the methods in this array; method; e.g., `'GET'` or `['POST', 'DELETE']`.

Type

array

Tags

None found

$secure

$secure : bool

When true, the `HTTPS` value must be `on`, or the `SERVER_PORT` must be 443. When false, neither of those values may be present. When null, it is ignored.

Type

bool

Tags

None found

$is_match

$is_match : callable

A callable to provide custom matching logic against the server values and matched params from this Route. The signature must be `function(array $server, \ArrayObject $matches)` and must return a boolean: true to accept this Route match, or false to deny the match.

Note that this allows a wide range of manipulations, and further allows the developer to modify the matched params as needed.

Type

callable

See also

Tags

None found

$generate

$generate : callable

A callable to modify path-generation values. The signature must be `function($route, array $data)`; its return value is an array of data to be used in the path. The `$route` is this Route object, and `$data` is the set of key-value pairs to be interpolated into the path as provided by the caller.

Type

callable

See also

Tags

None found

$routable

$routable : bool

If routable, this route should be used in matching. If not, it should be used only to generate a path.

Type

bool

Tags

None found

$name_prefix

$name_prefix : string

A prefix for the Route name, generally from attached route groups.

Type

string

Tags

None found

$path_prefix

$path_prefix : string

A prefix for the Route path, generally from attached route groups.

Type

string

Tags

None found

$regex

$regex : string

The $path property converted to a regular expression, using the $params subpatterns.

Type

string

Tags

None found

$matches

$matches : array

All param matches found in the path during the `isMatch()` process.

Type

array

See also

Tags

None found

$debug

$debug : array

Retain debugging information about why the route did not match.

Type

array

$wildcard : array

The name of the wildcard param, if any.

Type

array

Methods

__construct()

__construct(string $name, string $path, array $params, array $values, string|array $method, bool $secure, bool $routable, callable $is_match, callable $generate, string $name_prefix, string $path_prefix) : \Aura\Router\Route

Constructor.

Parameters

string $name

The name for this Route.
string $path

The path for this Route with param token placeholders.
array $params

Map of param tokens to regex subpatterns.
array $values

Default values for params.
string|array $method

The server REQUUEST_METHOD must be one of these values.
bool $secure

If true, the server must indicate an HTTPS request.
bool $routable

If true, this Route can be matched; if not, it can be used only to generate a path.
callable $is_match

A custom callable to evaluate the route.
callable $generate

A custom callable to generate a path.
string $name_prefix

A prefix for the name.
string $path_prefix

A prefix for the path.

Returns

isMatch()

isMatch(string $path, array $server) : bool

Checks if a given path and server values are a match for this Route.

Parameters

string $path

The path to check against this Route.
array $server

A copy of $_SERVER so that this Route can check against the server values.

Returns

bool

Tags

None found

generate()

generate(array $data) : string

Gets the path for this Route with data replacements for param tokens.

Parameters

array $data

An array of key-value pairs to interpolate into the param tokens in the path for this Route. Keys that do not map to params are discarded; param tokens that have no mapped key are left in place.

Returns

string

Tags

None found

setRegex()

setRegex() : void

Sets the regular expression for this Route based on its params.

Tags

None found

isRegexMatch()

isRegexMatch(string $path) : bool

Checks that the path matches the Route regex.

Parameters

string $path

The path to match against.

Returns

bool —

True on a match, false if not.

Tags

None found

isMethodMatch()

isMethodMatch(array $server) : bool

Checks that the Route `$method` matches the corresponding server value.

Parameters

array $server

A copy of $_SERVER.

Returns

bool —

True on a match, false if not.

Tags

None found

isSecureMatch()

isSecureMatch(array $server) : bool

Checks that the Route `$secure` matches the corresponding server values.

Parameters

array $server

A copy of $_SERVER.

Returns

bool —

True on a match, false if not.

Tags

None found

isCustomMatch()

isCustomMatch(array $server) : bool

Checks that the custom Route `$is_match` callable returns true, given the server values.

Parameters

array $server

A copy of $_SERVER.

Returns

bool —

True on a match, false if not.
